Skip to contents
SCP 0.1.2
  • Reference

    Integration_SCP

    Integration_SCP.Rd

    Single cell pipeline for the integration of multiple datasets.

    Usage

    Integration_SCP(
  srtMerge = NULL,
  batch = "orig.ident",
  append = TRUE,
  srtList = NULL,
  integration_method = "Uncorrected",
  do_normalization = NULL,
  normalization_method = "logCPM",
  do_HVF_finding = TRUE,
  HVF_source = "separate",
  HVF_method = "vst",
  nHVF = 2000,
  HVF = NULL,
  do_scaling = TRUE,
  vars_to_regress = NULL,
  regression_model = "linear",
  liner_reduction = "pca",
  liner_reduction_dims = 100,
  liner_reduction_distance = "euclidean",
  liner_reduction_dims_use = NULL,
  force_liner_reduction = FALSE,
  nonliner_reduction = "umap",
  nonliner_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),
  nonliner_reduction_distance = "cosine",
  do_cluster_finding = TRUE,
  cluster_algorithm = "louvain",
  cluster_resolution = 0.6,
  cluster_reorder = TRUE,
  seed = 11,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    srtMerge

    A merged Seurat object with batch information.

    batch

    Metadata column name containing the batch information.

    append

    Whether append results into the srtMerge. Only valid when srtMerge is provided.

    srtList

    A list of Seurat object.

    integration_method

    Integration method. Can be one of "Uncorrected", "Seurat", "fastMNN", "Harmony", "Scanorama", "BBKNN", "CSS", "LIGER".

    do_normalization

    Whether to normalize the data. If NULL, will automatically determine.

    normalization_method

    Normalization method.Can be one of "logCPM", "SCT".

    do_HVF_finding

    Whether to find the high variable features(HVF). If NULL, will automatically determine.

    HVF_source

    Source of the HVF. Can be one of "separate" and "global".

    nHVF

    HVF number to use.

    HVF

    Custom high variable features.

    do_scaling

    Whether to scale the data. If NULL, will automatically determine.

    vars_to_regress

    Variables to regress out.

    regression_model

    Use a linear model or generalized linear model (poisson, negative binomial) for the regression. Options are 'linear' (default), 'poisson', and 'negbinom'

    liner_reduction

    Liner reduction method name. Can be one of "pca", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca".

    liner_reduction_dims

    Dimensions to calculate when performing liner reduction.

    liner_reduction_distance

    A distance method if liner reduction need.

    liner_reduction_dims_use

    Which dimensions to use.

    nonliner_reduction

    Non-liner reduction method name. Can be one of "umap","umap-naive", "tsne", "dm".

    nonliner_reduction_dims

    Dimensions to calculate when performing non-liner reduction.

    nonliner_reduction_distance

    A distance method if non-liner reduction need.

    cluster_algorithm

    Algorithm for modularity optimization when finding clusters.

    cluster_resolution

    Cluster resolution parameter.

    cluster_reorder

    Whether to reorder the cluster names using hierarchical clustering.

    seed

    Set a random seed.

    Value

    A Seurat object containing the result.

    Examples

    # \donttest{
library(SeuratData)
#> ── Installed datasets ─────────────────────────── SeuratData v0.2.2 ──
#> ✔ cbmc            3.1.4            ✔ pbmcsca         3.0.0
#> ✔ celegans.embryo 0.1.0            ✔ ssHippo         3.1.4
#> ✔ hcabm40k        3.0.0            ✔ stxBrain        0.1.1
#> ✔ ifnb            3.1.0            ✔ stxKidney       0.1.0
#> ✔ panc8           3.0.2            ✔ thp1.eccite     3.1.5
#> ✔ pbmc3k          3.1.4            
#> ───────────────────────────────── Key ────────────────────────────────
#> ✔ Dataset loaded successfully
#> ❯ Dataset built with a newer version of Seurat than installed
#> ❓ Unknown version of Seurat installed
library(cowplot)
suppressWarnings(InstallData("ifnb"))
data("ifnb")
plist <- list()
for (method in c("Uncorrected", "Seurat", "fastMNN", "Harmony", "Scanorama", "BBKNN", "CSS", "LIGER")) {
  ifnb <- Integration_SCP(ifnb, batch = "stim", integration_method = method)
  p <- ClassDimPlot(ifnb, group.by = c("stim", "seurat_annotations"), theme_use = "theme_blank")
  plist[[method]] <- p
  print(p)
}
